lines.text: It doesn't do a man any good to tell him he has an incurable disease. Eventually the divine power which put us all here manages to remove the fear of death and replaces it with a great understanding.

[on a prescribed treatment plan]
Suppose I decide it isn't worth it?
Well, then you face a gradual disintegration of the brain, probable insanity, and a wretched living death.
I'll be glad when you two get married. All the good meals you're missing because you won't eat onions.
